inlet.digest: Incoming messages or state or bang to evolve

outlet.digest: bang when object is changed via the interface

method.name: (drag)
method.digest: Load file or set background image
method.description: Dragging an llll or text file on the object will load its content, if a proper readable format is recognized. If the file is an image, it will be loaded as object background (whenever meaningful)

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description:
• Enter: perform automaton step (go to next generation)
• ↓, ↑, ←, →: move all cells (respectively) down, up, left, right
• Tab: set automaton to a gaussian-distributed random configuration
↪ Add the Shift key to keep previously live cells.
• Backspace: clear all cells
• Spacebar: Toggle playback (i.e. toggle play attribute)
• Esc: send all notes-off and reset center to (0, 0) position

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
• click+drag: create new live cells
• Cmd+click+drag (mac) or Ctrl+click+drag (win): erase living cells
• right-click or two-fingers tap: open contextual menu for basic operations

method.name: (tools)
method.description:
Tools are combination of a specific key pressed and some mouse action. Whenever you press the key, if the tool is available, the mouse cursor will switch to the tool specific one.
Available tools are:
• Keep the Z key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to change the zoom
• Keep the X key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to move the displayed center
• Keep the N key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to modify its pitch.
• Keep the V key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to modify its velocity.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs a step of the automaton rule, possibly sending the played content through the play outlet (if play attribute is set to 1).

method.name: clear
method.description: The word clear sets the state of all cells to 0 (= dead).

method.name: clearall
method.description: The word clearall sets the state of all cells to 0 (= dead), even if the cells are outside the current world (so that if, at any moment, the world becomes bigger, its newly added cells are 0's). Also see the size attribute.

method.name: dump
method.description: The word dump dumps the state of all the cells in the form life (world CELLS), where CELLS is an llll containing N sub-lllls, each containing N integers (i.e. it is a N-by-N matrix). Each integer represents the state of a cell, and N equals exactly the world size (see size attribute). The state of the cell must be an integer from 0 to 255.

method.name: exportimage
exportpng
flush
method.description: The word flush force all the note-offs for notes being played to be sent. This is effective only when the play attribute is set to 1.

method.name: getcellsum
method.digest: Get the sum of all cells
method.description: Queries the sum of the values of all cells. Output is sent through the second outlet, preceded by the "cellsum" symbol. In the standard 0-1 valued case, this coincides with getnumliving; it does not coincide with it in the case of a general rule.

method.name: getnumliving
method.digest: Get the number of living cells
method.description: Queries the current number of living cells. Output is sent through the second outlet, preceded by the "numliving" symbol.

method.name: getnumliving
method.digest: Get the number of dead cells
method.description: Queries the current number of dead cells. Output is sent through the second outlet, preceded by the "numdead" symbol.

method.name: getsize
method.description: Queries the current size of the world. Output is sent through the second outlet, preceded by the "size" symbol.

method.name: random
read
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains loaded as current state. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: rule
method.digest: Set C code for custom rule

method.name: shift
method.description: The word shift followed by two integers (say, X and Y) shifts all the cells by X horizontal steps and Y vertical steps (positive values move right and upward, negative values move left and downward).

method.name: write
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in native format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: writetxt
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in a human-readable text format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

attribute.name: axescolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: axeslabelscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: axeslabelsfontsize
attribute.description: Sets the size of the axes labels font.

attribute.name: bgimage
attribute.description: Sets a background image texture, tiling the plane. Use "" or "none" to remove the image.

attribute.name: border
attribute.description: Sets the border conditions, establishing how the cells just beyond the world limits should be considered

attribute.name: born
attribute.description: Lists all the possibilities for the number of neighbours a dead cell must have in order to be born

attribute.name: candycane2
attribute.description: Specifies the 2nd cell color in candycane mode.

attribute.name: candycane3
attribute.description: Specifies the 3rd cell color in candycane mode.

attribute.name: candycane4
attribute.description: Specifies the 4th cell color in candycane mode.

attribute.name: candycane5
attribute.description: Specifies the 5th cell color in candycane mode.

attribute.name: candycane6
attribute.description: Specifies the 6th cell color in candycane mode.

attribute.name: candycane7
attribute.description: Specifies the 7th cell color in candycane mode.

attribute.name: candycane8
attribute.description: Specifies the 8th cell color in candycane mode.

attribute.name: cellalpha
attribute.description: s Sets the equation for the transparency of each cell. You can have "cell" (cell value), "x" and "y" (coordinates) as variables. Only accessible if colormap is set to custom.

attribute.name: cellblue
attribute.description: s Sets the equation for the blue component of each cell. You can have "cell" (cell value), "x" and "y" (coordinates) as variables. Only accessible if colormap is set to custom.

attribute.name: cellcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the "living" cells

attribute.name: cellgreen
attribute.description: s Sets the equation for the green component of each cell. You can have "cell" (cell value), "x" and "y" (coordinates) as variables. Only accessible if colormap is set to custom.

attribute.name: cellred
attribute.description: s Sets the equation for the red component of each cell. You can have "cell" (cell value), "x" and "y" (coordinates) as variables. Only accessible if colormap is set to custom.

attribute.name: cellsize
attribute.description: s Sets the equation for the size of each cell. You can have "cell" (cell value), "x" and "y" (coordinates) as variables.

attribute.name: cents
attribute.description:
Sets the equation for the cents associated to each cell. For instance, "6000 + 700 * x, + 500 * y" represents a standard Tonnetz.
You can substitute this equation with an explicit llll containing the pitch of each cell in the world matrix, in this case dada.life expects an llll containing a matrix with size rows and size columns (see size attribute).

attribute.name: colormap
continuousbang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang continuously during mousedrag actions.

attribute.name: customrule
attribute.description: Toggles the usage of the possibly defined custom rule for the automaton. The custom rule must be written in C and sent via the rule message.

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to embed the state of the object within the patcher.

attribute.name: extendedplay
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send extended playout information about cells.

attribute.name: grid
attribute.description: Sets the grid size, in coordinates.

attribute.name: gridcolor
attribute.description: Sets the grid color.

attribute.name: gridlabelscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the grid labels.

attribute.name: gridlabelsfontsize
attribute.description: Sets the size of the grid labels font.

attribute.name: lattice
attribute.description: Sets the lattice type (either 0 = square, which is the default, or 1 = triangular)

attribute.name: mapmax
attribute.description: Sets the maximum color mapping value for custom mapping rules (see colormap).

attribute.name: maxpitch
attribute.description: Sets the maximum pitch (in midicents) representable by a color. Such pitch will be associated to the violet color.

attribute.name: maxundosteps
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of undo steps (0 being: no undo).

attribute.name: messagebang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: minpitch
attribute.description: Sets the minimum pitch (in midicents) representable by a color. Such pitch will be associated to the red color.

attribute.name: neighborhood
attribute.description: Sets the neighborhood size (for the born and stayalive attributes, as well as for the custom rule).

attribute.name: notifypaint
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to notify every new redraw of the box via a "painted" symbol.

attribute.name: numcandycane
attribute.description: Sets the number of alternating candycane colors. Only pertinent if colormap is set to Candycane.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: play
attribute.description: Toggles the sequencing of every newly created cell, as well as the proper note-offs for no-longer-active cells.

attribute.name: playcolor
attribute.description: Sets the playing color.

attribute.name: playstep
attribute.description: Sets the play step interval in milliseconds.

attribute.name: randomdensity
attribute.description: Sets the default density for random generation of points on the lattice (in response to a random message, or to popup or keyboard requests).

attribute.name: shape
attribute.description: Sets the shape of the cells. If "Sprite" is chosen, then the sprite attribute must point to a valid image file.

attribute.name: showaxes
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: showaxeslabels
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: showgrid
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the grid.

attribute.name: showgridlabels
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the grid labels.

attribute.name: shownotes
showvelocity
size
attribute.description: Sets the world horizontal and vertical size (in cells)

attribute.name: sizefactor
attribute.description: Sets a factor for the cell coverage when a cell is "full".

attribute.name: snaptogrid
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to snap items to the grid.

attribute.name: sprite
attribute.description: Sets the filename of an image to be used as a sprite shape (see shape attribute).

attribute.name: stayalive
attribute.description: Lists all the possibilities for the number a living cell must have in order to stay alive

attribute.name: undobang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: undobeforeplay
attribute.digest: Save State For Undo Before Playing
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to save the state for an undo step before playing

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Save State For Undo Before Playing

attribute.name: velocity
attribute.description: Sets the equation for the velocity associated to each cell

attribute.name: verboseundo
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to post undo/redo steps in the Max window.

attribute.name: vzoom
attribute.description: Sets the object vertical zoom percentage

attribute.name: xlabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the x axis.

attribute.name: ylabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the y axis.

attribute.name: zoom
attribute.description: Sets the object zoom percentage (or horizontal zoom, if the object is separately zoommable on horizontal and on vertical axis).

entry.name: Inlet 1 (bang/llll/anything)
entry.description: Incoming messages or state or bang to evolve.

entry.name: Outlet 4 (bang)
entry.description: bang when object is changed via the interface.
